title: How to Get Powerups in Need for Speed

methods.name: Getting Powerups via End-of-race Reward Cards

steps.headline: Enter the NFS World Free World mode.
steps.description: On the game’s Main screen, click the “Play” button and press Enter on your keyboard to display your NFSW profile details. Click “Enter World” to enter the NFSW world in Free Roam mode.

steps.headline: Locate a race.
steps.description: Drive around the game world (Up Arrow key to accelerate, Down Arrow key to brake/reverse, Left Arrow key to steer left, and Right Arrow key to steer right) and find a race marker. Race markers in NFS World appear as an arrow-shaped race track with a ring around it.

steps.headline: Start a race.
steps.description: Drive anywhere close to the marker, and press “[“ (left bracket) on your keyboard. This will put you in the waiting list of players waiting to start the race. As soon as the countdown time has elapsed, the race will start.

steps.headline: Complete the race.
steps.description: Once you finish the race, five reward cards will appear on the screen, and you will have the option of choosing one out of them. You get these reward cards regardless of the position you finish the race in.

steps.headline: Click on the reward card you want.
steps.description: The reward card may give you a free Powerup, a free car upgrade, or free SpeedBoost. If the reward card you chose has a free Powerup, a notification will appear on the screen confirming the same and telling you exactly the kind of Powerup you’ve won.

methods.name: Getting Powerups by Purchasing Them Using SpeedBoost

steps.headline: Enter the NFS World Free World mode.
steps.description: On the game’s Main screen, click the “Play” button and press Enter on your keyboard to display your NFSW profile details. Click “Enter World” to enter the NFSW world in Free Roam mode.

steps.headline: Go to your SafeHouse.
steps.description: You can do this by pressing “H” on your keyboard or by clicking the SafeHouse button on the top right-hand corner of the NFSW screen.

steps.headline: Enter the Powerup Console.
steps.description: Do this by clicking “Powerup Console” on the SafeHouse menu. In the Powerup Console, you will find two panes: the right-hand pane is the Event Mode pane and the left-hand pane is the Powerups pane.

steps.headline: Select an event type (e.g., circuit, sprint) on the Event Mode pane.
steps.description: This will display the icons of different Powerups that can be used for such an event on the Powerups pane. You can tell what Powerup each icon represents by hovering your mouse on it and reading the tooltip that appears.

steps.headline: Find how much a Powerup cost.
steps.description: To recharge a Powerup using this method, you must be able to pay its SpeedBoost price. Your SpeedBoost balance is displayed on the top right-hand corner of the NFSW screen, and you can find out how much a Powerup costs by dragging its icon and hovering it on top of the Powerup Recharger box (located on the bottom right part of the Powerup Console screen) without releasing it. This will display the price next to the Recharger box.

steps.headline: Purchase a Powerup.
steps.description: To recharge (purchase) a Powerup, drag its icon from the Powerups pane onto the Powerup Recharger box. If you have the required SpeedBoost balance, you will have instantly recharged/purchased that Powerup.
